nav.div: Clear Creek » News » CCISD Today » Frequently Asked Questions

div.span:
Below you will find a list of frequently asked questions regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19) and how it impacts CCISD learning and activities.
If you have a question that has not yet been answered, please click here to submit it.

div.script:
$(document).ready(function () {
        var logConsole = function (str) {
            console.log(str);
        };
        if ($('#tabPortlet_564687 .divTabEdit').val() == "True") {
            var isModern = ('True');
            if(isModern.toLowerCase() == "true")
            {
                var tabObj = $('#tabPortlet_564687 ');
                var tabM = $('#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs').attr('portlet') == 'tab';

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_0","title":"Will students have to make up the days they miss?","content":"Clear Creek ISD is seeking guidance from the Texas Education Agency regarding this. No decision or additional information is available at this time.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_1","title":"What is expected of students now for distance learning? ","content":"
Teachers will be contacting parents and students to outline learning expectations. This communication will occur no later than 4:30 p.m. on Wednesday, March 18, 2020. If you have questions, please reach out to your teacher through itsLearning. Clear Creek ISD has also established a Digital Learning Resource page to help families access learning resources. Click here. ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_2","title":"What if my student does not have a device for distance learning?","content":"
Students in grades 6-12 have district issued computer devices. If you do not have a district issued laptop, access to a computer at home or the internet, Clear Creek ISD Technology Department needs to hear from you. Please fill out this form. We also suggest that you reach out to your campus administration to see if they are distributing items. Contact information can be found on the campus websites.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_3","title":"What if our house does not have WiFi?","content":"
Comcast has made xFinity Wi-Fi available for free use beginning 03/15/2020 for at least the next 60 days. To use this service, connect to “xfinitywifi” only. Visit here to learn more. \n
CCISD Outdoor wireless is available at the following CCISD sites. If you do use these locations, please follow CDC guidelines for social distancing. Visit www.cdc.gov.\n\n    
Campbell Elementary\n    
Clear Brook High School\n    
Clear Creek High School\n    
Clear Falls High School Athletic Fields\n    
Clear Lake City Elementary\n    
Clear Lake High School Athletic Fields\n    
Greene Elementary\n    
Landolt Elementary \n    
League City Elementary\n    
McWhirter Elementary\n    
Wedgewood Elementary\n    
Westbrook Intermediate\n    
Whitcomb Elementary\n\n","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_4","title":"Is there a technology helpdesk?","content":"Yes, CCISD Technology is providing remote helpdesk support to students. Support is available Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. – 4:00 p.m. by calling 281-284-0500 and choosing option 4.
\n
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_5","title":"What if my child has medication at school or left something in their locker?","content":"
The district and campus leaders are developing a plan to open schools on a staggered schedule to permit families to retrieve items from their lockers or medications and supplies from the clinic. When the schedule is completed and approved, each school will communicate with parents.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_6","title":"What if families don’t have transportation for the free meals? Can community members pick up and deliver?","content":"
Current federal regulations require that children be present to receive meals. Should this change, we will re-assess this question. Older students who can drive are able to pick up meals with younger students present.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_7","title":"Can we volunteer to help the schools pass out free meals?","content":"
Due to sanitation reasons and in accordance with CDC recommendations, we cannot open distribution up to volunteers.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_8","title":"Is STAAR testing cancelled? What about End Of Course (EOC) and Advanced Placement (AP) testing?","content":"
STAAR
\n
\nYes, Governor Abbott has waived STAAR testing requirements for the 2019-2020 school year. \n
TEA Student Assessment is currently evaluating all scenarios as a result of the Governor’s decision to cancel all STAAR assessments this year.  This includes the EOC graduation requirements.  TEA will be updating all stakeholders with formal communication later this week.  As soon as the formal communication is provided, updates will be provided to campus administrators, parents, and students.\nAP TESTS
\n
\nStudents now have access to free, live AP review lessons, delivered by AP teachers from across the country. These optional, mobile-friendly classes are designed to be used alongside work that may be given by schools. These classes will also be available on-demand, so teachers and students can access them at any time. The lessons will focus on reviewing the skills and concepts from approximately the first 75% of the yearlong courses and about half of the semester courses. There will also be some supplementary lessons covering the final 25% of the course. 
\n
\nAll AP exams will be in an online, open book, open note format and 45 minutes in length. All questions will be free response and students may be required to cite primary and secondary sources for responses. All questions will focus on application of learning through written response. AP test outlines will include content to be tested on each exam. Students and teachers are encouraged to review these to prepare for the exam. Visit the Digital Resources page for login instructions.
\n
\nVisit the College Board website for updates on AP Testing  https://apcentral.collegeboard.org/about-ap/news-changes/coronavirus-update. 
\n
\n","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_9","title":"What is being done to help support students who receive special services at home?","content":"\n    
ARD Meetings\n    \n        
Due to school building closures, all instruction will move to the Its Learning online portal. All ARDs will begin via Skype or telephone beginning March 23, 2020. Team leaders will reach out to you to determine the best mode of communication for your student’s ARD meeting. \n    \n    \n    
Online Instruction\n    \n        
Online instruction will include modifications and accommodations as related to your student’s current needs. These will be provided by the teachers or in class support staff no different than in classroom instruction. Your student’s case manager will be communicating via telephone or email to check on student progress and offer assistance as needed.\n    \n    \n    
APE\n    \n        
If your student receives Adapted PE (APE), the teacher will communicate with you by the end of this week. Beginning March 23, 2020, the teacher will send lessons electronically. If you have questions, please contact your student’s teacher.\n    \n    \n    
Related/Instructional Services: (for students with these services specified in their IEP)\n    \n        
Counseling, Psychological Services, Speech Therapy, and Music Therapy will be provided via telephone/Skype to each student who has this service in their IEP. These providers will be in contact with you to determine the best mode of communication. \n        
Assistive Technology, Occupational Therapy, Physical Therapy and Vision Services providers will be in contact with you to determine the best way to meet the needs of your student during online instruction. These services will be provided to the extent possible while online instruction continues. Once the school building opens, all services as specified in the student’s IEP will continue. If you feel your student is in need of increased service time due to time spent in online instruction, an ARD will be convened to determine the individual needs of your student once we return to campuses. \n        
AI – AI teachers will be contacting you with resources and information about instruction and assignments, as well as accessing auditory information in online content as applicable to your student’s amplification.\n    \n    \n","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_10","title":"I am a parent and I am not receiving emails from the school or CCISD. How do I fix this?","content":"
Please log in to your Skyward Family Access account and be sure your email is correct. If you are still having issues, CCISD is arranging for specific windows for campus phones to be open for calls.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_11","title":"Are proms cancelled?","content":"
The campus staff is working diligently with the venues to see if there is a possibility to reschedule. Click here for more information.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_12","title":"Are sports and extracurriculars cancelled for the rest of school?","content":"
All school-related events have been canceled through April 10, 2020. The District will reassess after this date.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_13","title":"How do I answer my student's questions about COVID-19?","content":"
Clear Creek ISD is committed to providing families support during this challenging time. A parent guide is available from the CCISD Counseling Team here.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_14","title":"Will substitutes still be paid?","content":"If you are a long-term substitute and currently on an assignment, you will be paid.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_15","title":"My student is having issues with ItsLearning. ","content":"Itslearning is experiencing performance issue due to high demand.  We hope these issues are temporary and will be resolved soon.  You can track itslearning performance status at https://status.itslearning.com/","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_16","title":"What do I do if I enrolled students before Spring Break or would like to enroll them currently?","content":"Campuses are enrolling student now. Visit www.ccisd.net/enroll. Campuses will contact the parent to begin sending resources.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_17","title":"How does my student get a Verification of Enrollment (VOE)?","content":"Please contact your campus counselor. Contact information can be found on the campus websites.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_18","title":"What will happen with our dual credit courses? Summer registration?","content":"College of the Mainland Students: All dual credit classes will be moved to 100% online for the next two weeks beginning Monday, March 23.  Dual Credit students should check their COM email and Blackboard. 
\n
\nSan Jacinto Community College Students: Continue to monitor Blackboard for the most up to date information from your professors. 
\n
\nClear Horizons Early College students should continue to monitor information for their campus for information regarding all classes.
\n
\nHigh School Campuses are working with San Jacinto College and College of the Mainland to determine a plan for summer and fall dual credit registration. Campuses will communicate information as it becomes available.
\n
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_19","title":"Will elementary students be given laptops?","content":"At this time, there are no plans to distribute laptops to elementary students.  Alternate plans are being developed at the campus level.  Please contact your campus staff for support with assignments.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl14_divTabs_20","title":"I have multiple children who are using one device. How do I set up multiple profiles so I do not have to logout of itsLearning every time?","content":"When multiple children (users) are using a single device, often a single sign-on requires multiple profiles.  Please visit this webpage for instructions on how to use one device for multiple students: https://bit.ly/3bO0OBB
\n
\nIf you or your children have any questions during this COVID crisis relating to technology, please call the CCISD Technology Help Desk at 281.284.0500 M-F, 8:00-4:00.
\n
","active":false,"disabled":false}],// required,
                        propPaneId: 'paneId', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propTitle: 'title', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propActive: 'active', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propDisabled: 'disabled', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propContent: 'content', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        tabMode : tabM,
                        scrollToTabEdge: false, // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        disableScrollArrowsOnFullyScrolled: false // optional- pass in default value for demo purposes
                    }).on('ready.scrtabs', function() {
                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }
    });
